alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 2:53PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 251 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing strong winds and possibly a landspout just north of Knotts Island, or 10 miles northeast of Currituck, moving east to southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Virginia Beach around 255 PM EDT. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
